segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is flowing over the edge of the sink, and I can't help but feel surprised by her oblivion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's as if she is living in her own little world, unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for her to realize that the floor is becoming a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem to be planning something mischievous, and I feel an unsettling tension building.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for the cookie jar, his body wobbling precariously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't noticed him; the stool looks ready to topple any moment now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's eager anticipation is evident; she is practically glowing at the thought of cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s amusing, in a way, to see their little operation unfold without any adult supervision.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I can’t shake off the dread of what might happen if the boy falls.
segments.speaker: PAR
